00059 typedef __u32 lvar_hash_t;
00060 
00061 enum {
00062         IAM_LFIX_ROOT_MAGIC = 0xbedabb1edULL,
00063         IAM_LVAR_ROOT_MAGIC = 0xb01dface
00064 };
00065 
00066 struct iam_lfix_root {
00067         u_int64_t  ilr_magic;
00068         u_int16_t  ilr_keysize;
00069         u_int16_t  ilr_recsize;
00070         u_int16_t  ilr_ptrsize;
00071         u_int16_t  ilr_indirect_levels;
00072 };
00073 
00074 enum {
00075         IAM_LEAF_HEADER_MAGIC = 0x1976,
00076         IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC   = 0x1973
00077 };
00078 
00079 struct iam_leaf_head {
00080         u_int16_t ill_magic;
00081         u_int16_t ill_count;
00082 };
00083 
00084 struct dx_countlimit {
00085         u_int16_t limit;
00086         u_int16_t count;
00087 };
00088 
00089 struct lvar_leaf_header {
00090         u_int16_t vlh_magic; /* magic number IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC */
00091         u_int16_t vlh_used;  /* used bytes, including header */
00092 };
00093 
00094 struct lvar_root {
00095         u_int32_t vr_magic;
00096         u_int16_t vr_recsize;
00097         u_int16_t vr_ptrsize;
00098         u_int8_t  vr_indirect_levels;
00099         u_int8_t  vr_padding0;
00100         u_int16_t vr_padding1;
00101 };
00102 
00103 struct lvar_leaf_entry {
00104         u_int32_t vle_hash;
00105         u_int16_t vle_keysize;
00106         u_int8_t  vle_key[0];
00107 };
00108 
00109 enum {
00110         LVAR_PAD   = 4,
00111         LVAR_ROUND = LVAR_PAD - 1
00112 };
00113 
00119 #define STORE_UNALIGNED(val, dst)               \
00120 ({                                              \
00121         typeof(*(dst)) __val = (val);           \
00122                                                 \
00123         memcpy(dst, &__val, sizeof *(dst));     \
00124 })
00125 
00126 static int root_limit(int rootgap, int blocksize, int size)
00127 {
00128         int limit;
00129         int nlimit;
00130 
00131         limit = (blocksize - rootgap) / size;
00132         nlimit = blocksize / size;
00133         if (limit == nlimit)
00134                 limit--;
00135         return limit;
00136 }
00137 
00138 static int lfix_root_limit(int blocksize, int size)
00139 {
00140         return root_limit(sizeof(struct iam_lfix_root), blocksize, size);
00141 }
00142 
00143 static void lfix_root(void *buf,
00144                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00145 {
00146         struct iam_lfix_root *root;
00147         struct dx_countlimit *limit;
00148         void                 *entry;
00149 
00150         root = buf;
00151         *root = (typeof(*root)) {
00152                 .ilr_magic           = cpu_to_le64(IAM_LFIX_ROOT_MAGIC),
00153                 .ilr_keysize         = cpu_to_le16(keysize),
00154                 .ilr_recsize         = cpu_to_le16(recsize),
00155                 .ilr_ptrsize         = cpu_to_le16(ptrsize),
00156                 .ilr_indirect_levels = 0
00157         };
00158 
00159         limit = (void *)(root + 1);
00160         *limit = (typeof(*limit)){
00161                 /*
00162                  * limit itself + one pointer to the leaf.
00163                  */
00164                 .count = cpu_to_le16(2),
00165                 .limit = lfix_root_limit(blocksize, keysize + ptrsize)
00166         };
00167 
00168         entry = root + 1;
00169         /*
00170          * Skip over @limit.
00171          */
00172         entry += keysize + ptrsize;
00173 
00174         /*
00175          * Entry format is <key> followed by <ptr>. In the minimal tree
00176          * consisting of a root and single node, <key> is a minimal possible
00177          * key.
00178          *
00179          * XXX: this key is hard-coded to be a sequence of 0's.
00180          */
00181         entry += keysize;
00182         /* now @entry points to <ptr> */
00183         if (ptrsize == 4)
00184                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le32(1), (u_int32_t *)entry);
00185         else
00186                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le64(1), (u_int64_t *)entry);
00187 }
00188 
00189 static void lfix_leaf(void *buf,
00190                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00191 {
00192         struct iam_leaf_head *head;
00193 
00194         /* form leaf */
00195         head = buf;
00196         *head = (typeof(*head)) {
00197                 .ill_magic = cpu_to_le16(IAM_LEAF_HEADER_MAGIC),
00198                 /*
00199                  * Leaf contains an entry with the smallest possible key
00200                  * (created by zeroing).
00201                  */
00202                 .ill_count = cpu_to_le16(1),
00203         };
00204 }
00205 
00206 static int lvar_root_limit(int blocksize, int size)
00207 {
00208         return root_limit(sizeof(struct lvar_root), blocksize, size);
00209 }
00210 
00211 static void lvar_root(void *buf,
00212                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00213 {
00214         struct lvar_root *root;
00215         struct dx_countlimit *limit;
00216         void                 *entry;
00217         int isize;
00218 
00219         isize = sizeof(lvar_hash_t) + ptrsize;
00220         root = buf;
00221         *root = (typeof(*root)) {
00222                 .vr_magic            = cpu_to_le32(IAM_LVAR_ROOT_MAGIC),
00223                 .vr_recsize          = cpu_to_le16(recsize),
00224                 .vr_ptrsize          = cpu_to_le16(ptrsize),
00225                 .vr_indirect_levels  = 0
00226         };
00227 
00228         limit = (void *)(root + 1);
00229         *limit = (typeof(*limit)) {
00230                 /*
00231                  * limit itself + one pointer to the leaf.
00232                  */
00233                 .count = cpu_to_le16(2),
00234                 .limit = lvar_root_limit(blocksize, keysize + ptrsize)
00235         };
00236 
00237         entry = root + 1;
00238         /*
00239          * Skip over @limit.
00240          */
00241         entry += isize;
00242 
00243         /*
00244          * Entry format is <key> followed by <ptr>. In the minimal tree
00245          * consisting of a root and single node, <key> is a minimal possible
00246          * key.
00247          *
00248          * XXX: this key is hard-coded to be a sequence of 0's.
00249          */
00250         entry += sizeof(lvar_hash_t);
00251         /* now @entry points to <ptr> */
00252         if (ptrsize == 4)
00253                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le32(1), (u_int32_t *)entry);
00254         else
00255                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le64(1), (u_int64_t *)entry);
00256 }
00257 
00258 static int lvar_esize(int namelen, int recsize)
00259 {
00260         return (offsetof(struct lvar_leaf_entry, vle_key) +
00261                 namelen + recsize + LVAR_ROUND) & ~LVAR_ROUND;
00262 }
00263 
00264 static void lvar_leaf(void *buf,
00265                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00266 {
00267         struct lvar_leaf_header *head;
00268         char                    *rec;
00269 
00270         /* form leaf */
00271         head = buf;
00272         *head = (typeof(*head)) {
00273                 .vlh_magic = cpu_to_le16(IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC),
00274                 .vlh_used  = cpu_to_le16(sizeof *head + lvar_esize(0, recsize))
00275         };
00276         rec = (void *)(head + 1);
00277         rec[offsetof(struct lvar_leaf_entry, vle_key)] = recsize;
00278 }

00281 struct iam_uapi_op {
00282         void *iul_key;
00283         void *iul_rec;
00284 };
00285 
00286 struct iam_uapi_it {
00287         struct iam_uapi_op iui_op;
00288         __u16              iui_state;
00289 };
00290 
00291 enum iam_ioctl_cmd {
00292         IAM_IOC_INIT      = _IOW('i', 1, struct iam_uapi_info),
00293         IAM_IOC_GETINFO   = _IOR('i', 2, struct iam_uapi_info),
00294         IAM_IOC_INSERT    = _IOR('i', 3, struct iam_uapi_op),
00295         IAM_IOC_LOOKUP    = _IOWR('i', 4, struct iam_uapi_op),
00296         IAM_IOC_DELETE    = _IOR('i', 5, struct iam_uapi_op),
00297         IAM_IOC_IT_START  = _IOR('i', 6, struct iam_uapi_it),
00298         IAM_IOC_IT_NEXT   = _IOW('i', 7, struct iam_uapi_it),
00299         IAM_IOC_IT_STOP   = _IOR('i', 8, struct iam_uapi_it),
00300         IAM_IOC_POLYMORPH = _IOR('i', 9, unsigned long)
00301 };
00302 
00303 static unsigned char hex2dec(unsigned char hex)
00304 {
00305         if (('0' <= hex) && (hex <= '9'))
00306                 return hex - '0';
00307         else if (('a' <= hex) && (hex <= 'f'))
00308                 return hex - 'a' + 10;
00309         else if (('A' <= hex) && (hex <= 'F'))
00310                 return hex - 'A' + 10;
00311         else
00312                 exit(1);
00313 }
00314 
00315 static unsigned char *packdigit(unsigned char *number)
00316 {
00317         unsigned char *area;
00318         unsigned char *scan;
00319 
00320         area = calloc(strlen((char *)number) / 2 + 2, sizeof(char));
00321         if (area != NULL) {
00322                 for (scan = area; *number; number += 2, scan++)
00323                         *scan = (hex2dec(number[0]) << 4) | hex2dec(number[1]);
00324         }
00325         return area;
00326 }
00327 
00328 static char *iam_convert(int size, int need_convert, char *source)
00329 {
00330         char *ptr;
00331         unsigned char *opt;
00332 
00333         if (source == NULL)
00334                 return NULL;
00335 
00336         ptr = calloc(size + 1, sizeof(char));
00337         if (ptr == NULL)
00338                 return NULL;
00339 
00340         if (need_convert) {
00341                 opt = packdigit((unsigned char*)source);
00342                 if (opt == NULL) {
00343                         free(ptr);
00344                         return NULL;
00345                 } else {
00346                         memcpy(ptr, opt, size + 1);
00347                         free(opt);
00348                 }
00349         } else {
00350                 strlcpy(ptr, source, size + 1);
00351         }
00352 
00353         return ptr;
00354 }
00355 
00356 static int iam_doop(int fd, struct iam_uapi_info *ua, int cmd,
00357                     int key_need_convert, char *key_buf,
00358                     int *keysize, char *save_key,
00359                     int rec_need_convert, char *rec_buf,
00360                     int *recsize, char *save_rec)
00361 {
00362         int ret;
00363         char *key;
00364         char *rec;
00365         struct iam_uapi_op op;
00366 
00367         key = iam_convert(ua->iui_keysize, key_need_convert, key_buf);
00368         if (key == NULL)
00369                 return -1;
00370 
00371         rec = iam_convert(ua->iui_recsize, rec_need_convert, rec_buf);
00372         if (rec == NULL) {
00373                 free(key);
00374                 return -1;
00375         }
00376 
00377         op.iul_key = key;
00378         op.iul_rec = rec;
00379         ret = ioctl(fd, cmd, &op);
00380         if (ret == 0) {
00381                 if ((keysize != NULL) && (*keysize > 0) && (save_key != NULL)) {
00382                         if (*keysize > ua->iui_keysize)
00383                                 *keysize = ua->iui_keysize;
00384                         memcpy(save_key, key, *keysize);
00385                 }
00386                 if ((recsize != NULL) && (*recsize > 0) && (save_rec != NULL)) {
00387                         if (*recsize > ua->iui_recsize)
00388                                 *recsize = ua->iui_recsize;
00389                         memcpy(save_rec, rec, *recsize);
00390                 }
00391         }
00392         free(key);
00393         free(rec);
00394         return ret;
00395 }
00396 
00397 
00398 /*
00399  * Creat an iam file, but do NOT open it.
00400  * Return 0 if success, else -1.
00401  */
00402 int iam_creat(char *filename, enum iam_fmt_t fmt,
00403               int blocksize, int keysize, int recsize, int ptrsize)
00404 {
00405         int fd;
00406         char *buf;
00407 
00408         if (filename == NULL) {
00409                 errno = EINVAL;
00410                 return -1;
00411         }
00412 
00413         if ((fmt != FMT_LFIX) && (fmt != FMT_LVAR)) {
00414                 errno = EOPNOTSUPP;
00415                 return -1;
00416         }
00417 
00418         if (blocksize <= 100) {
00419                 errno = EINVAL;
00420                 return -1;
00421         }
00422 
00423         if (keysize < 1) {
00424                 errno = EINVAL;
00425                 return -1;
00426         }
00427 
00428         if (recsize < 0) {
00429                 errno = EINVAL;
00430                 return -1;
00431         }
00432 
00433         if (ptrsize != 4 && ptrsize != 8) {
00434                 errno = EINVAL;
00435                 return -1;
00436         }
00437 
00438         if (keysize + recsize + sizeof(struct iam_leaf_head) > blocksize / 3) {
00439                 errno = EINVAL;
00440                 return -1;
00441         }
00442 
00443         fd = open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_TRUNC | O_CREAT, 0600);
00444         if (fd < 0) {
00445                 return -1;
00446         }
00447 
00448         buf = malloc(blocksize);
00449         if (buf == NULL) {
00450                 close(fd);
00451                 return -1;
00452         }
00453 
00454         memset(buf, 0, blocksize);
00455         if (fmt == FMT_LFIX)
00456                 lfix_root(buf, blocksize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00457         else
00458                 lvar_root(buf, blocksize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00459 
00460         if (write(fd, buf, blocksize) != blocksize) {
00461                 close(fd);
00462                 free(buf);
00463                 return -1;
00464         }
00465 
00466         memset(buf, 0, blocksize);
00467         if (fmt == FMT_LFIX)
00468                 lfix_leaf(buf, blocksize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00469         else
00470                 lvar_leaf(buf, blocksize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00471 
00472         if (write(fd, buf, blocksize) != blocksize) {
00473                 close(fd);
00474                 free(buf);
00475                 return -1;
00476         }
00477 
00478         close(fd);
00479         free(buf);
00480         return 0;
00481 }
00482 
00483 /*
00484  * Open an iam file, but do NOT creat it if the file doesn't exist.
00485  * Please use iam_creat for creating the file before use iam_open.
00486  * Return file id (fd) if success, else -1.
00487  */
00488 int iam_open(char *filename, struct iam_uapi_info *ua)
00489 {
00490         int fd;
00491 
00492         if (filename == NULL) {
00493                 errno = EINVAL;
00494                 return -1;
00495         }
00496 
00497         if (ua == NULL) {
00498                 errno = EINVAL;
00499                 return -1;
00500         }
00501 
00502         fd = open(filename, O_RDONLY);
00503         if (fd < 0) {
00504                 return -1;
00505         }
00506 
00507         if (ioctl(fd, IAM_IOC_INIT, ua) != 0) {
00508                 close(fd);
00509                 return -1;
00510         }
00511 
00512         if (ioctl(fd, IAM_IOC_GETINFO, ua) != 0) {
00513                 close(fd);
00514                 return -1;
00515         }
00516 
00517         return fd;
00518 }
00519 
00520 /*
00521  * Close file opened by iam_open.
00522  */
00523 int iam_close(int fd)
00524 {
00525         return close(fd);
00526 }
00527 
00528 /*
00529  * Please use iam_open before use this function.
00530  */
00531 int iam_insert(int fd, struct iam_uapi_info *ua,
00532                int key_need_convert, char *key_buf,
00533                int rec_need_convert, char *rec_buf)
00534 {
00535         return iam_doop(fd, ua, IAM_IOC_INSERT,
00536                         key_need_convert, key_buf, NULL, NULL,
00537                         rec_need_convert, rec_buf, NULL, NULL);
00538 }
00539 
00540 /*
00541  * Please use iam_open before use this function.
00542  */
00543 int iam_lookup(int fd, struct iam_uapi_info *ua,
00544                int key_need_convert, char *key_buf,
00545                int *keysize, char *save_key,
00546                int rec_need_convert, char *rec_buf,
00547                int *recsize, char *save_rec)
00548 {
00549         return iam_doop(fd, ua, IAM_IOC_LOOKUP,
00550                        key_need_convert, key_buf, keysize, save_key,
00551                        rec_need_convert, rec_buf, recsize, save_rec);
00552 }
00553

00555  * Please use iam_open before use this function.

00557 int iam_delete(int fd, struct iam_uapi_info *ua,
00558                int key_need_convert, char *key_buf,
00559                int rec_need_convert, char *rec_buf)

00561         return iam_doop(fd, ua, IAM_IOC_DELETE,
00562                         key_need_convert, key_buf, NULL, NULL,
00563                         rec_need_convert, rec_buf, NULL, NULL);
00564 }

00605 
00606 /*
00607  * Change iam file mode.
00608  */
00609 int iam_polymorph(char *filename, unsigned long mode)
00610 {
00611         int fd;
00612         int ret;
00613 
00614         if (filename == NULL) {
00615                 errno = EINVAL;
00616                 return -1;
00617         }
00618 
00619         fd = open(filename, O_RDONLY);
00620         if (fd < 0) {
00621                 return -1;
00622         }
00623 
00624         ret = ioctl(fd, IAM_IOC_POLYMORPH, mode);
00625         close(fd);
00626         return ret;
00627 }
